hackathon-description-text: Join us for BU's annual overnight hackathon! Make, hack, innovate, and create with other students for 24 hours. Build something cool, eat free food, meet new peeople, and compete to win cash prizes. It's all happening on March 28 at BU's new Engineering Product Innovation Center.
hackathon-eligibility: Any student can attend. While we can't reimburse you for travel, we'll provide free food and drink. We will have limited sleeping space, so come rested or plan to stay with a friend if you aren't local.
hackathon-requirements: Our only restriction is that you cannot use existing work (e.g. code/designs) if participating for prizes. You can only use open source code or designs (i.e. things anyone can freely access).
hackathon-rules:
By participating in the MakeBU Hackathon, you consent to being photographed.
We ask that participants who intend to participate for prizes not use preexisting work (code, designs).
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Boston University, 750 Commonwealth Avenue, Brookline, MA 02446, USA
hackathon-location-address: Boston University, 750 Commonwealth Avenue, Brookline, MA 02446, USA
